HDG.BC.content: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [on style] Ground-Concepts as demand to reach ground of all that is, of what can therefore be called beings > anticipation of essential (Wesenhaft) more vital (wesentlich) than certainty of calculating the w/out essence (Wesenlos) > thinking in anticipation (Ahnen), for anticipation, essentially more rigorous/exacting than formal-conceptual cleverness of calculable: we must practice such knowing, readiness to make ourselves free for essential

HDG.BC.content: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth
HDG.BC.linkedContent: modern position is the “technological,” epoch is technological, already decided mode of world-interpretation: interprets possibilities for any human attitude, preforms them acc. their capacity for implementation > practical mastery of technology presupposes metaphysical subjugation to technology, grasp everything acc. plan/calculation, to secure what can last for longest possible duration > Nietzsche clearly envisioned that this will [of technology] would attain unconditional shape in 20th century, unconditional mastery of earth

HDG.WM.content: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy
HDG.WM.linkedContent: practical goals, technical organization: unites dispersed atrophied sciences [Husserl] > exactness of science vs. rigor of philosophy

HDG.FS.content: Kant: “I have therefore found it necessary to deny (aufheben) knowledge, in order to make room for faith” > precisely this bringing-to-its-place (an-seinen-Ort-bringen) of theoretical knowledge [this Aufhebung] allows corresponding location (entsprechende Ortschaft) of practical reason to become visible
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kant: “I have therefore found it necessary to deny (aufheben) knowledge, in order to make room for faith” > precisely this bringing-to-its-place (an-seinen-Ort-bringen) of theoretical knowledge [this Aufhebung] allows corresponding location (entsprechende Ortschaft) of practical reason to become visible

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]

HDG.FS.content: in Greek, theōria means residing (Sichaufhalten) in gaze (Erblicken) of being; today, theory is a programming? program: Anzeige (indication), vorausgreifende Festlegung (anticipatory establishment), Mitteilung einer Planung (communication of a plan)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in Greek, theōria means residing (Sichaufhalten) in gaze (Erblicken) of being; today, theory is a programming? program: Anzeige (indication), vorausgreifende Festlegung (anticipatory establishment), Mitteilung einer Planung (communication of a plan)

HDG.FS.content: meaning of hypothesis, thus theory, has changed: “assuming that…” as purely methodological, no ontological significance > Heidegger on exactitude of modern experimentation, yield identical repeating results, obstructs description (Beschreibung), concerns the effect (Wirkung) [cf. p. 54]: theory will change if effect does not follow, thus purely methodological
HDG.FS.linkedContent: meaning of hypothesis, thus theory, has changed: “assuming that…” as purely methodological, no ontological significance > Heidegger on exactitude of modern experimentation, yield identical repeating results, obstructs description (Beschreibung), concerns the effect (Wirkung) [cf. p. 54]: theory will change if effect does not follow, thus purely methodological

HDG.FS.content: contemporary theory: operating instructions for carrying out experiment
HDG.FS.linkedContent: contemporary theory: operating instructions for carrying out experiment

HDG.MA.content: meditative thinking (like calculative thinking [?]), requires greater effort, demands more practice [askesis], must be cared for, must wait > anyone can follow path of meditative thinking in own manner, w/in own limits: man is a thinking/meditating being
HDG.MA.linkedContent: meditative thinking (like calculative thinking [?]), requires greater effort, demands more practice [askesis], must be cared for, must wait > anyone can follow path of meditative thinking in own manner, w/in own limits: man is a thinking/meditating being

HDG.WL.content: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: attempting a way to language by speaking testifies (bezeugt) that language has woven us into speaking [why?] > this web (Geflecht) is the predetermined realm (vorbestimmten Bereich) that any reflection on language (linguistic theory, philosophy of language, etc.) must live (aufhalten) [factical life of language]

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: epistemology still doesn’t understand that all theories of judgment are im Grunde theories of presentation (Vorstellungstheorie)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: epistemology still doesn’t understand that all theories of judgment are im Grunde theories of presentation (Vorstellungstheorie)

HDG.OHF.content: significance not a characteristic of things but of being > theories re: actuality (Wirklichkeit) and reality need to be subjected (unterwerfen) to critical phenomenological destruction: such a critique only actualized (vollziehen) from out of positive insight (Sicht) [already attend to Being?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: significance not a characteristic of things but of being > theories re: actuality (Wirklichkeit) and reality need to be subjected (unterwerfen) to critical phenomenological destruction: such a critique only actualized (vollziehen) from out of positive insight (Sicht) [already attend to Being?]
